mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Sheriff Ruben Tall to George Peter, 1831 March 24
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tall, Ruben
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Letter from the sheriff of Dorchester County, Maryland regarding the sale of runaway slave Jim (Dembis or Dernbis) using the alias 'Isaac Turner' (or Henry?) for $190 to William D. Collier of Salisbury , Somerset County, Maryland, agent for Mr. Woolfolk. The letter outlines the expenses for the apprehension, boarding, fees of justice of peace, advertising, etc. in the amount of $52.40 to be deducted from the sale. Autograph letter signed by Ruben Tall, Sheriff and John Donovan, Justice of the Peace, 1 page, with integral address panel addressed to The Honorable George Peter, Darnes Town or Senecca Mills, Maryland. Postmarked Cambridge, Md. March 30.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Slavery
